pr_title: Modify HighHeapUsageYoungGenRca to better detect sizing issues

timeline.bodyText:
Please rename to something on the lines of FULL_GC_TIME_THRES_MS.
It has a confusing overlap with leader/follower timeouts in ES. Full gc pauses impact multiple things, in addition to failed fd checks. Naming it around what it is used for in the scope of code helps understanding your Rca logic better.
timeline.author: vigyasharma

timeline.bodyText: Should we add metrics for which of the sub-condition was breached?
timeline.author: vigyasharma

timeline.message:
Modify HighHeapUsageYoungGenRca to better detect sizing issues

- Now takes full GC pause time into account when making decisions
- Takes into account the amount of garbage mistakenly promoted into the

timeline.bodyText: can multiple metrics be identified as "too high" at the same time ? Do we want to add multiple resource summaries into flowunit in that case ?
timeline.author: rguo-aws

replies.bodyText:
This is too complex of a change for this diff. Currently FlowUnit contains a Union of various summary types. One way to do this would be to create a new CompoundResourceSummary type that tracks issue counts across various resources with a Map and add that into the FlowUnit union.
However, this is a structural change and I'd like to avoid making it here. As is, I believe this diff evaluates conditions in a reasonable conservative order.
replies.author: sidheart

timeline.bodyText: I suggest that we should also check if full GC count > 0 in the last 5 sec time interval

replies.bodyText: Checked in the else case in the upcoming PR
replies.author: sidheart

timeline.message:
Consider full GC events in the YoungGenRca

We used to conclude that if the old gen heap increased between
observations, then it meant that a full GC event occurred.

We now explicitly check if a full GC event occurred using metrics.
